intro: Psychine stylosa var. maroccana, commonly known as the Moroccan psychine, is a rare and endemic plant species found primarily in the arid regions of Morocco. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and has adapted to withstand high temperatures and limited water availability. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, while its flowers are small and white, often clustered together. Due to its restricted habitat and ecological significance, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
